# Analysis of the MEAC Tournament Quarterfinal Game Between South Carolina State and Coppin State on March 12, 2025  

The Mid-Eastern Athletic Conference (MEAC) Men’s Basketball Tournament quarterfinal game between the second-seeded South Carolina State Bulldogs and the seventh-seeded Coppin State Eagles took place as scheduled on **March 12, 2025, at 8:00 PM EDT** at the Norfolk Scope Arena in Norfolk, Virginia. According to verified reports from multiple authoritative sources, including the MEAC’s official website, ESPN, and the Associated Press, **South Carolina State defeated Coppin State by a final score of 68-63**[6][7][8]. The Bulldogs advanced to the tournament semifinals, extending their winning streak to 10 games, while Coppin State’s season concluded with a 6-24 record[6][7].  

### Game Outcome and Key Details  
South Carolina State entered the game as the MEAC’s second seed with an 18-12 overall record and an 11-3 conference mark, while Coppin State finished the regular season at 6-23 (4-10 MEAC)[2][4]. The Bulldogs’ victory was anchored by senior guard Wilson Dubinsky, who scored a game-high 20 points, including four three-pointers, and a critical 8-for-8 performance from the free-throw line in the final minutes to secure the win[6][7]. Coppin State’s Peter Oduro led the Eagles with 15 points, but the team’s late rally fell short despite cutting the deficit to three points in the final minute[6][8].  

The game proceeded without postponement or cancellation, as evidenced by post-game recaps published on March 13, 2025[6][7][8]. No sources indicated irregularities or disruptions to the schedule.  

### Resolution of the Market Query  
Given the confirmed outcome of the game and the absence of any postponement or cancellation, the market resolves unambiguously to **p1 (South Carolina State)**.
